newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares close up, seen lacking strength.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares close up, seen lacking strength.

text.p: Austrian shares trudged higher on Wednesday, taking their cue from overall buyoant European markets, but failed to hold on to the day's highs.
Traders said volumes remained thin and there was little indication the market could muster up the strength to attack a strong technical resistance level at 1,040 points in the ATX this week.
The blue-chip index rose 7.86 points or 0.8 percent to close at 1,030.23, down from the day's high of 1,035.13. Among its constituents, 16 gainers outnumbered five decliners.
"I expect the market to swing back and forth between 1,020 and 1,040 points," said one trader. The index has been stuck in that range for more than six weeks now.
Traders noted strong interest, particularly by German investors, in privatisation candidate Creditanstalt, for which the Austrian government has demanded to receive a final offer by midnight Friday.
"There's certainly enough customers who want to jump on the bandwagon before that date," said one trader.
Creditanstalt's preferred shares rose five schillings to 484, while its common stock was up six at 666 schillings.
Energy and chemicals group OMV rse 18.50 to 1,027.50 in above-average turnover. Traders said the gains were a delayed reaction to Tuesday's rise in international oil stocks.
Luxury hosiery maker Wolford led the day's decliners, falling 60 schillings to 2,490.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index rose 2.62 points or 0.65 percent to close at 403.27.
On the Vienna futures and options exchange, ATX contracts for September delivery were up six points at 1,026.0.
